Authors:
Kyrylo G Savchenko, Lori M. Carris, Lisa A. Castlebury,
Vasyl P. Heluta, Solomon P Wasser, Eviatar Nevo
Title:
Revision of Entyloma (Entylomatales, Exobasidiomycetes) on
Eryngium
Keywords:
Host diversity ∙ New species ∙ Phytopathogen ∙ Smut fungi
Taxonomy
Abstract:
The genus Entyloma consists of more than 160 species of
smut fungi distributed worldwide. These species are found on dicots with
Apiaceae being one of the main host families. This study aims to clarify
the systematics and phylogeny of Entyloma on Eryngium (Apiaceae) with
molecular and morphological data. Eleven species from this group are
discussed herein. Four of them are described as new taxa: E. carmeli sp.
nov. on Eryngium falcatum, E. eryngii-cretici sp. nov. on Eryngium
creticum, E. eryngii-maritimi sp. nov. on Eryngium maritimum and E.
ho-chunkii sp. nov. on Eryngium yuccifolium. Analysis of the ITS region
of rDNA is presented and supports the monophyly of Entyloma species on
Apiaceae and polyphyly of Entyloma on Eryngium. Within the Entyloma on
Apiaceae a cluster of species with anamorphs is presented, proving the
idea that the anamorph is a taxonomically important character for
delimitation of species of Entyloma
